name: Transport capacity
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Flow/slope balance incoming sediment, avoiding major bars or deep scour, unless imbalance is historically normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Screen stream power using discharge and slope and compare with observed bars or scour. Detailed transport modeling is beyond screening.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Deep scour and exposed armor. Few bars remain.
Criteria: Shields well above critical range. Persistent over-capacity (Knighton 1998).

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Large new bars in straight sections. Pools infilling.
Criteria: Shields well below critical range. Under-capacity relative to supply.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Modest bar growth in low-energy sections. Some narrowing.
Criteria: Shields slightly below critical range. Minor deposition.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Bars form on inner bends and migrate gradually. Pools maintained.
Criteria: Bankfull Shields stress ~0.03-0.06 and consistent with D50. Morphology shows balanced scour/fill (Buffington & Montgomery 1997).
